::DarkMouse::

She winced as a twinge of pain ran through her. It was her some of 
her internal systems fully coming on line.  She looked at Quickstrike 
and whispered,"What's the matter commander, never saw a bot returned 
from the matrix before?" She gave a weak chuckle. "Well, don't worry, 
neither have I, and I was never expecting it to be me." She chuckled 
again. 
She turned her head to face him."Hey commander, promise me one 
thing.  When I'm better and can fight again, will you go with me to 
take out Megatron? We owe him you know. I just want to pay him back 
for sending us on that fools mission. And I was the fool to take it." 
She felt a tear run down her face. She whispered very softly so she 
was barely audiable, "A damned fool I was. I was following the wrong 
leader." She turned her head away from Quickstrike. "I should have 
just followed you and never listened to Megatron."
She pulled the pelt up a little further and covered her face.  She 
didn't want him to see her face while she cried to herself. She 
thought of Quickstrike as a brother.  She had always looked up to him 
as a big brother. And sometimes felt responsable for him.  She knew 
that she had almost gotten him killed in that attack.  That thought 
made her feel ashamed.


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, wilddance_mare@h... wrote:
> Quickstrike:
> 
> Quickstrike looked at Dark Mouse. "Don't think ah fergot 'bout ya." 
> he said to her. He ducked his head and walked around to the other 
> side of the table where she was laying and turned his shoulder to 
> her, looking out a the hallway. Where was Black Arachnia? He had 
> questions he wanted to ask her. 
> 
> He slowly turned his head to Dark Mouse, but not completely his 
> face. "Anything ah can get fer ya?" He almost added Sugar-bot, but 
> she wasn't 'sugar-bot'. That didn't fit her. Black Arachnia 
> was 'sugar-bot'.
> 
> He was nervous, but he was going to be a gentlebot.
